intro: Tarenna incana, commonly known as the white tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves that are usually covered in fine white hairs. Its flowers are clustered in inflorescences and are typically white or pale yellow, adding to its ornamental value. Tarenna incana is often cultivated for its aesthetic appeal and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
